techmeme.title: Lions Gate Entertainment, the studio behind The Hunger Games, John Wick, and Twilight, signs a deal with Runway to use generative AI in its movies and TV shows (Jessica Toonkel/Wall Street Journal)
TechInsights: China's YMTC upgraded its "Xtacking" tech, which stacks memory cells in layers, to rival NAND industry leaders, but significant challenges remain (Debby Wu/Bloomberg)
HTC unveils the $999 Vive Focus Vision, a standalone VR headset with built-in eye tracking, 16MP stereo color front-facing cameras, and more, for pre-order now (Devindra Hardawar/Engadget)
Apple releases updates to improve iPhone 16 repairability, including changes to the battery, TrueDepth Camera, and Face ID, and launches a Repair Assistant (Steve Dent/Engadget)
Apple says Apple Intelligence will support German, Italian, Korean, Portuguese, Vietnamese, and other languages in 2025, and is in talks with the EU and China (Brian Heater/TechCrunch)
